name: mustard production | mustard | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19421/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of Mustard during October, 2016-March, 2017 at a farm located in village Balahri Kalan, District Fatehgarh Sahib of Punjab. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 2,500 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 19-October, 2016 and harvesting date is 15-March, 2017. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 148.75-86.25 kg/ha. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 12.48 kg/ha using plough, planking and rotary cultivator for soil tillage

This activity starts about six weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in first week of October and sowing of seeds started about two weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 5 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature mustard from the Mustard plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 05-October, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 15-March, 2017. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 148 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Balahri Kalan, District Fatehgarh Sahib of Punjab
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Mustard follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. The data has been approximated using Rape seed as proxy since the tool at this stage could not support non existing crops in ecoeditor. Number of wet days have been taken for the neighboring district (Ludhiana) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Punjab where the farm is located.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area

Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'mustard' is calculated to be circa 9.40E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.88E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
